page.title: 09THE MASTS
page.content: The Wart, the highest point on the island at 65 metres above sea level, is the site of the{radio station}and {two steel pylons.}The taller pylon is 52 metres high and was erected by Balfour Beattie in 1976. It has eight dishes attached and has a red aircraft -warning light on top. This pylon is {not fully operational,}and its{purpose is{obscure.}The smaller pylon plays an important part in the{radio-telephone links of the of the Northern Isles. The first radio station on the hill was built in the early 1940s during World War II. The diesel-generating shed was sunk in the ground to prevent bomb damage. In 1955 the present station was built and two engineers used to attend to its electricity generator.Now there is a mains supply, with standby generator. {
